comments.body: I wonder if its worth 'treading lightly' and only calling 'Start-Service' if Netlogon isn't currently running?  Would potentially avoid an unneeded warning if using Basic auth?
Probably not, if the service is already running it shouldn't be doing anything. If an error comes up then it's probably a sign of a bigger issue and we should know about it.

We will want to double check `-WhatIf` actually works on the `Install-ADDSForest` cmdlet. There are a few cases where I've seen this get ignored (win_share) and the AD cmdlets don't instill confidence in me.
Hmm, I expected -WhatIf to always work, especially since there doesn't seem to be much logic to it (as we hoped it would). And I see we don't have integration tests for **win_domain**.

Same but I've been bitten once which has forced me to check things where we didn't use the behaviour before. I would be surprised if it didn't honour it but still something we need to check considering there are no tests.

> And I see we don't have integration tests for win_domain.

Yep that's unfortunate, there's probably little we can test but there should still be some smoke tests to make sure the module is syntactically correct.
You've set `$create_dns_delegation` with a default value so it will never be null. Can just have this set in your initial hashtable unless you should change the arg definition instead.

A boolean value can still be null, if it was explicitly set to be. That's why I tend to always compare to $null. I wasn't sure in this case whether it would be better to have a default (not being specified) to do what Install-ADDSForest would do when the option is missing, or whether it was better to force a specific behavior regardless of how the command may change in the future.
After reviewing, the documentation clearly stated no default, so the arg_spec was simply wrong. This implementation was correct.
The changes in this module should be in a separate PR as they modify how the module behaves.
Honestly, I just added it on the fly since it seemed the most logical thing for that section, I don't mind removing it of course
It's not wrong, but it belongs in another PR where it will be discussed/accepted on its own merits.
removed but for the record, I do think a different PR just for this is an overkill

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@        # NOTE: AD-Domain-Services includes: RSAT-AD-AdminCenter, RSAT-AD-Powershell and RSAT-ADDS-Tools
        $awf = Add-WindowsFeature AD-Domain-Services -WhatIf:$check_mode
        $result.reboot_required = $awf.RestartNeeded
        # FUTURE: Check if reboot necessary
